description: Modern Latin, from Latin digitālis (“of the fingers”) (named in reference to the German common name for the plant, Fingerhut (“thimble”)). Doublet of digital.

entries.meaning: Any plant of the genus Digitalis (herbaceous plants of the Plantaginaceae family, including the foxglove, Digitalis purpurea).
(medicine) A medical extract of Digitalis purpurea prescribed for heart failure etc.
examples: ‘You very nearly died. I had to give you digitalis three times.’
